# Vercel build issue with SVG file (2025-09-27 10:37Z)

_**User (2025-09-27 02:52Z)**_

Why is my vercel build failing to get @neo14Logo.svg in @Navbar.tsx but other images in public load fine?

---

Case-sensitivity mismatch: the file is at `public/branding/SVG/neo14Logo.svg` (uppercase "SVG"), but the Navbar references `/branding/svg/neo14Logo.svg` (lowercase "svg"). On case-sensitive systems (e.g., Vercel), this causes a 404. Updating the path to `/branding/SVG/neo14Logo.svg`.


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: app/components/Navbar.tsx</summary>

```diff
@@ -117,5 +117,5 @@
            &lt;Link href=&quot;/&quot; aria-label=&quot;Cospace home&quot; className=&quot;flex items-center group&quot;&gt;
              &lt;Image 
-               src=&quot;/branding/svg/neo14Logo.svg&quot; 
+               src=&quot;/branding/SVG/neo14Logo.svg&quot; 
                alt=&quot;Cospace by NEO14&quot; 
                width={120} 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---

Case-sensitivity mismatch caused the Vercel build failure.

**The Problem:**
- File location: `public/branding/SVG/neo14Logo.svg` (uppercase "SVG")
- Code reference: `/branding/svg/neo14Logo.svg` (lowercase "svg")

**The Solution:**
Updated the path in `Navbar.tsx` from `/branding/svg/neo14Logo.svg` to `/branding/SVG/neo14Logo.svg` to match the actual directory.

**Why this happens:**
- Windows is case-insensitive, so it worked locally
- Vercel’s Linux environment is case-sensitive
- The path must match the exact case

The build should pass now.

---
